programme.desc: Louis van Gaal staat bekend als trainer van grote clubs als Ajax, Barcelona, Bayern München en Manchester United. programme.title: 50+ Years of Sport
programme.desc: In het sportjaar 1972 vond het drama op de Olympische Spelen in München plaats, won Billie Jean King haar vierde Grand Slam, boekte de LA Lakers een legendarische zegereeks, en won de schaaklegende Bobby Fischer het wereldkampioenschap schaken.

programme.title: 50+ Years of Sport
programme.desc: In het sportjaar 1973 speelde Cruijff in Barcelona, behaalde Jackie Stewart zijn laatste F1 winst, vochten Foreman en Frazier een legendarische bokswedstrijd vondt de Battle of the Sexes plaats.

programme.title: Storie di GP: Canada 1991
programme.desc: E' la quinta prova del 1991. Sul circuito di Montreal, intitolato a Gilles Villneuve, Patrese con la Williams-Renault e' in pole position, seguito dal suo compagno di scuderia Nigel Mansell.

programme.title: Canada 1997 - F1
programme.desc: Canada 1997 - F1 - La F1 fa tappa a Montreal per la 7a prova della stagione '97. Shumacher con la Ferrari ha conquistato la pole position e parte davanti a Villeneuve che gioca in casa.

programme.title: GP Canada 2007
programme.desc: GP Canada 2007 - Sesta tappa del mondiale di F1. Sulla griglia di partenza davanti a tutti ci sono le McLaren di Hamilton e Alonso. Quarta e quinta invece le Ferrari di Raikkonen e Massa.

programme.title: Canada 2018 - F1
programme.desc: Canada 2018 - F1 - Edizione numero 69 per il Mondiale di Formula 1. Ventuno gran premi, venti piloti e un solo obiettivo: diventare il nuovo campione del mondo! Vettel in pole position, secondo Bottas.

programme.title: Nico e Paolo
programme.desc: Nico e Paolo - Chiacchiere sulla F1 a 360 gradi: protagonisti Nico Rosberg, campione del mondo 2016, e Paolo Barilla, pilota di F1 nel 1990 e vincitore di una 24 Ore di Le Mans. Con Carlo Vanzini e Roberto Chinchero

programme.desc: England (2-0-0) has won each of the six all-time encounters against Andorra (0-0-2), including a 5-0 road victory on Oct. 9, 2021, as Ben Chilwell, Bukayo Saka, Tammy Abraham, James Ward-Prowse and Jack Grealish each found the back of the net.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the sprint race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Romania (1-0-1) defeated San Marino, 5-1, in Week 2; Austria (0-0-0) improved to 2-2-1 all-time against Tricolorii across all competitions after securing a 1-0 victory in a 2020-21 UEFA Nations League B group stage match, as Alessandro Schöpf scored.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Austin Green secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Charlotte over Grant Enfinger; Connor Zilisch averaged 149.44 en route to his win at Michigan last year, beating eventual 2024 champion Andres Perez by 0.701 seconds.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Port Adelaide (4-7-0) has lost four in a row after falling to Fremantle, 100-51, on May 24; GWS (7-5-0) has won the past two meetings, including a 73-51 victory last season, as Josh Kelly had 27 disposals and added a goal in the final two minutes.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Atlético Ottawa claimed a 3-1 victory against Pacific in their first meeting of the season on May 3 behind 2 assists from Samuel Salter in the second half; Atlético goalkeeper Nathan Ingham recorded 7 saves and 3 clearances in the win.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: San Marino (0-0-2) suffered a 5-1 setback at home to Romania in Week 2; Bosnia-Herzegovina (2-0-0) is 2-0-0 all-time against La Serenissima across all competitions after earning a 3-0 triumph in a UEFA World Cup qualifier at home on Oct. 8, 2005.

programme.title: Robson v Na 2012
programme.desc: Having defeated a three-time US Open champion in the second round, Great Britain's Laura Robson came up against China's Li Na in the third round of the women's singles at the 2012 US Open.

programme.title: ATP Final: Doha
programme.desc: In Doha, Great Britain's Jack Draper - entering his fifth ATP final - comes up against fifth seed and 2020 tournament champion Andrey Rublev in the final of the 2025 Qatar Open. (22.02)

programme.title: WTA Final: Doha
programme.desc: Jelena Ostapenko's near seven-year wait to vie for a WTA 1000 title ends in Doha, as the former Grand Slam champion faces 23-year-old American Amanda Anisimova in an unseeded final. (15.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships, an ATP Tour 500 event in the United Arab Emirates. (01.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Dubai
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned in Dubai. Russia's Mirra Andreeva - the youngest-ever WTA finalist - and Denmark's Clara Tauson face off for glory. (22.02)

programme.title: Alcaraz v Ruud 2022
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz and Casper Ruud went toe to toe in the final of the men's singles at the 2022 US Open. With the Arthur Ashe stage set, both players were going for a first career Grand Slam.

programme.title: Murray v Djokovic 2012
programme.desc: With the weight of a nation on his shoulders, Sir Andy Murray took to the court in pursuit of his first Grand Slam title having lost his previous four finals. His opponent: Novak Djokovic.

programme.title: Roddick v Ferrero 2003
programme.desc: In what was the crowning achievement in the career of the big-serving American, Andy Roddick defeated Juan Carlos Ferrero to capture his one and only Grand Slam title at the 2003 US Open.

programme.desc: A chance for Novak Djokovic to join Jimmy Connors and Roger Federer in winning a 100th tour-level title, as the 38-year-old Serb battles Hubert Hurkacz in the Geneva Open final. (24.05)

programme.title: Raducanu v Fernandez 2021
programme.desc: Going 10 rounds without dropping a set, Great Britain's Emma Raducanu claimed the women's title at the 2021 US Open, becoming the first-ever qualifier to win a singles Grand Slam.
